thread.title: Police: Two cases of forged, unauthorized checks amount to theft of more than $35K - Glencoe News
thread.title_full: Police: Two cases of forged, unauthorized checks amount to theft of more than $35K - Glencoe News

author: Pioneer Press
title: Police: Two cases of forged, unauthorized checks amount to theft of more than $35K - Glencoe News
text:
The following items were taken from Glencoe Public Safety Department reports and press releases. An arrest does not constitute a finding of guilt.
THEFT
A bronze sculpture valued at $4,500 was reported missing on Sept. 17 from a home on the 300 block of Keystone Court, police said. The item was missing after a move to Chicago and an investigation is pending.
DECEPTION
An amount of $3,000 was reported missing from a checking account of a resident on the 200 block of Franklin Road after an unauthorized check was reported cashed at 2:23 p.m. Sept. 21, police said. An investigation is pending.
FORGERY
Forged checks amounting to $33,000 from a checkbook at a home on the 100 block of Maple Hill Road that were subsequently cashed was reported at 12:32 p.m. Sept. 23, police said. An investigation is pending.
 Theft Glencoe
